column4: help, hey peeps i need to kno how to view all mount points that have ever been created
help, hey peeps i need to kno how to view all mount points that have ever been created
help, hey peeps i need to kno how to view all mount points that have ever been created
hm, no go wat happened was i had changed the mount point for one of my externals but there was an error in the mount point so now ubuntu is saying it can mount because of that error
that gives me all the mount points for drives currently mounted
but not the ones i cant mount
guys any word, i need to FIX a MOUNT POINT for an external
its not recognizing so i dont kno the path for it
try lsusb and blkid in the terminal
make sure the external is powered on
check in gconf-editor , under system > storage,  if you whave someting that looks like your usb device listed there,  delete it and restart the comp
start gconf-editor from the command line,  look under system > storage > defaults
aer we talking about a usb external hdd ?
standard english please
and when you plug it in (currently) , do you see any icon poping up on your desktop ?
so the device is not getting mounted,  so you don't need to delete any mount point, we just need to figure out why it is not mounting
what filesystem
got ntfs-3g setup on this comp ?
open up fstab and find the line for your usb device , and comment it out,  then , reboot the comp and try plugging the usb exernal hdd again
it probably doesn't say usb in it ,  it should have your previous mount point listed in it however
browse the /etc folder have a look at previous versions of your fstab files,  there are usualy a few backups in there
